sentences.en: He is a man of proud mien.
He left the room with a saddened mien.
sentences.cn: 他神情黯然地离开了房间.

sentences.en: He was a Vietnam veteran with a haunted mien.
sentences.cn: 他是个越战老兵,举止总有些惶然.

sentences.en: I fear thy mien , thy tones, thy motion.
sentences.cn: 我怕你的风度 、 举止 、 声音.

sentences.en: It was impossible to tell from his mien whether he was offended.
sentences.cn: 从他的神态中难以看出他是否生气了。

sentences.en: She had something of an estranged mien.
sentences.cn: 她有些落落寡合的样子.

sentences.en: She maintained her serious mien until the interview was over.
sentences.cn: 直到访问结束她一直保持严肃的态度.

sentences.en: The young girl in the picture has a thoughtful and solemn mien.
sentences.cn: 画中的年轻女孩带着一副沉思而又严肃的神态.

sentences.en: There were moments , Christine thought, when he had the mien of a mischievous elf.
sentences.cn: 克丽丝汀觉得他有时真象个恶作剧的小精灵.

sentences.en: With his wonted , collected and stately mien, he crossed the unhallowed threshold.
sentences.cn: 他摆出平时那种泰然自若的庄严态度, 跨过那个污浊的门槛.

trans.tran_en: a person’s typical expression or appearance
